title: Simon G. English
text:
ResearchGate
  
  
    
     Github
  
  
    
     Google Scholar
  

  
  
Simon is a quantitative biologist and scientific writer interested in how and why wild animal populations (especially birds) have changed through time.



Scientific writing (see select publications)
Bayesian statistical model building with NIMBLE and Stan
Programming with R, LaTeX, and Markdown
Statistical analysis

Hidden Markov modelling for imperfectly observed data
Population viability analysis
Linear, generalized linear, mixed-effects, and censored regression
Stable isotope mixing models

title: Contributions
text:
English SG, Wilson S, Bandivadekar R, Graves EE, Holyoak M, Brown J, Tell LA. 2022. Quantifying phenology and migratory behaviours of hummingbirds using single-site dynamics and mark-detection analyses. Proc. R. Soc. B. 289.
English SG, Hess H, Bishop CA, Porter E, Cheng KM, Elliott JE. 2022. Bioaccumulation and effects of selenium from surface coal mining on an aquatic songbird. Env. Res. 208, 112702.
English SG, Colwell RR, Robinson BW, Ernest HB, Bishop CA, Bandivadekar R, Tell LA. 2021. Demography of two species and one genus of hummingbirds with contrasting population trends in California, USA. J. Field Ornithol. 92, 475-484.
English SG, Bishop CA, Wilson S, Adam SC. 2021. Current contrasting population trends among North American hummingbirds. Sci. Rep. 11.
Read WF, English SG, Hick KG, Bishop CA. 2021. Bluebirds experience impaired hatching success in conventionally sprayed apple orchard habitats: a 31-year study* . Environ. Toxicol. Chem. 40, 3369-3378.
* Environmental Toxicology and Chemistry’s top 10 Exceptional Papers of 2021
English SG, Sandoval-Herrera NI, Bishop CA, Cartwright M, Maisonneuve F, Elliott JE, Welch Jr. KC. 2021. Neonicotinoid pesticides exert metabolic effects on avian pollinators. Sci. Rep. 11.

title: Simon G. English
text:
Education
University of British Columbia, Vancouver, Canada | Ph.D. in Forest and Conservation Sciences | Jan 2022 - present

NSERC CGS-D ($105’000 [$35’000 \(\times\) 3 years])
Four-Year-Fellowship Award ($20’600)
President’s Academic Excellence Initiative PhD Award ($600)

University of Toronto, Toronto, Canada | Master’s in Cell and Systems Biology | Sept 2018 - Sept 2020

NSERC CGS-M ($17’500)
Ontario Graduate Scholarship ($15’000)
MITACS RTA ($6’000)

Carleton University, Ottawa, Canada | Bachelor’s in Neuroscience and Biology | Sept 2014 - June 2018

Dean’s Summer Research Internship ($4’600)

title: Simon G. English
text:
Experience
Independent Contractor | Research Analyst and Scientific Writer | Jan 2021 - present

Analyzed diverse datasets including geospatial, remote-sensing, environmental contaminant, and demographic monitoring data for assessing impacts of human activities on animal populations (see the Publications page for select peer-reviewed works).

Canada Revenue Agency, Data Analytics and Exploration | Research Analyst | Jan 2022 - July 2022

Analyzed and compared machine learning methods to detect weak signals and patterns in high-dimensional data. Wrote R scripts to conduct simulation experiments using neural-network and random forest algorithms.

title: Publications
Publications
Contributions
text:
Invited talks
English SG, et al.. 2022. Hummingbird Demography in northwestern North America. In Rocky Point Bird Observatory - 2022 Hummingbird Meeting.
English SG, et al.. 2019. An integrative analysis of the effects of imidacloprid on the ruby-throated hummingbird (Archilochus colubris). In Rocky Point Bird Observatory - 2019 Hummingbird Meeting, Chilliwack, Canada.

title: Contributions
text:
Podium presentations

English SG, et al.. 2019. An integrative analysis of the effects of imidacloprid on the ruby-throated hummingbird (Archilochus colubris). In Society of Environmental Toxicology and Chemistry North America, Toronto, Canada.
English SG, et al.. 2019. An integrative analysis of the effects of imidacloprid on the ruby-throated hummingbird (Archilochus colubris). In Canadian Society of Zoologists, Windsor, Canada.
